info.p: Turtle is designed to be a compact and easy-to-read textual format for serializing RDF graphs. RDF graphs represent information as a collection of subject-predicate-object triples. It is a subset of the older Notation3 (N3) language, but unlike full N3, Turtle is restricted to only expressing valid RDF graphs.
The main "official" location for the core specification is at W3C RDF 1.1 Turtle (Terse RDF Triple Language).
